meanings.definition: To erect or set up in advance.
meanings.sent1: The workers will preerect the stage before the concert.
meanings.sent2: He likes to preerect the tent before going camping.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to preerect its nest in the tree for the winter.
meanings.sent4: She preerected her defenses before the argument even started.
meanings.sent5: The students preerected their project display for the science fair.

meanings.definition: To become erect or stand up straight before the expected time.
meanings.sent1: The flowers preerect in the morning sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The flagpole preerects proudly in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to preerect its tail when it sees a bird.
meanings.sent4: The building seemed to preerect itself as the sun rose behind it.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's hair preerected with excitement before the race.
